665377400175493.description:
Onward and Upward Travel Club: elegant escorted luxury trips featuring fashion, food, art, culture, and chocolate. 

Experience a springtime jaunt through DC, as Club Founder Valerie Beck opens her address book and takes us to top spots with local cultural creators. 

Pillar of the trip: the annual Cherry Blossom Festival. We'll participate through art, a tree tour with a National Ranger, and a kimono trunk show. We'll pick up on the Calder exhibition in Los Angeles - which we will have seen on our trip earlier this year - with a visit to one of Calder's grandest artworks at the National Gallery in DC, and add a wine and chocolate tasting to the mix with a local celebrity pastry chef as we welcome spring in our nation's capital. 

2 nights, Friday 4/4/14 - Sunday 4/6/14, Hotel Monaco DC. 

Includes private airport transfer, hotel, nightly wine receptions, meals, cherry blossom tour and other themed sightseeing, special National Gallery and Freer-Sackler Museum visits, wine and chocolate pairing with a local DC celebrity pastry chef.

$2,400 per person.

Uplift Through Travel!
www.onwardandupwardtravelclub

Join Carson and enjoy another Powermastery tour de force trip to enjoy the incredible Cherry Blossoms in Washington DC from Saturday to Sunday, March 29 - 30, 2014.

- Grab n Go breakfast Sunday morning

With a course that will take you through historic towns and sites and a finish line party in the nation's capital, this course is often called "Ragnar's Best Kept Secret". You'll start running from the town of Cumberland, Maryland and your team will head east through thick forest trails and scenic paths. Around nightfall, you'll run through the quiet streets of many charming historic Civil War-era towns, ultimately passing within the shadows of the Washington Monument and the Lincoln Memorial. Celebrate with your teammates as you storm the finish line together in Washington DC. This is a running event you don't want to miss.

771133072916502.description: Low-wage workers across the U.S. and here in Washington, D.C. have been leading an historic struggle for an end to "Low-Wage America". Workers in the midst of this fight for living wages and respect are rapidly organizing and taking a stand by picketing, striking, and building community solidarity. They are smashing the bosses' misconceptions that the labor movement is dying and some workers are just "unorganizable". Join the leaders of this movement in DC, including Walmart strikers, day laborer organizers, and many others, for a Low-Wage Workers Speak-Out to share stories of struggle, and build solidarity and workers' power. Low-wage workers of DC, unite!

791915957505157.description: The Race for Hope DC, a 5K course in the nation's capital, is a fun and inspiring way to join forces in the fight against brain tumors by raising funds for research. It is one of the largest fundraisers in the country benefiting the brain tumor community and the proceeds support National Brain Tumor Society and Accelerate Brain Cancer Cure. Through generous gifts from individuals and company sponsorships, the Race for Hope - DC has raised nearly $20 million in its history. Join thousands of runners and walkers supporting the brain tumor community on May 4, 2014, to participate in the 17th Annual Race for Hope - DC at Freedom Plaza in Washington, DC.

792381887456344.description:
At 4:20pm every day during the early 1970s, a group of teens in San Rafael, California went to a wall outside of school grounds to smoke pot. They called their afternoon toke “420,” but never envisioned the code word becoming a worldwide phenomenon.

These days, hundreds of thousands of stoners across the globe celebrate April 20th like it’s marijuana Christmas. In the United States, Washington, D.C., doubles as America’s cannabis capital come 420 Day.

420 Day Washington, D.C. 2014 is chock-full of 420 Day celebrations like Overgrow the Government National 4/20 Rally 2014. There, hemp lovers unite and rally, urging bureaucrats to reconsider their years-long pot prohibition.

High, patriotic protestors can roam the National Mall to come up with their own theories as to whether or not the area is steeped in hidden Masonic code. Blazed Dan Browns are free to stop in one of the 10 Smithsonian museums along the park’s outer edges, where they’ll find plenty of visual stimulation.

Though pot might not be legal quite yet in America’s capital, 420 Day events in Washington, D.C., rival those in any other American city, or any city in the world for that matter. Whether you smoke up, down, or out, there’s no doubt you’ll have a blast at 420 Day Washington, D.C., 2014.
792381887456344.name: 420 Day Washington, D.C. 2014

799362516760134.description:
The Ringling Bros. circus is coming to Washington DC! Please join local PETA supporters to rally against the use of animals in circuses. 

Thursday, March 20, 12 noon–1 p.m. and 6:30–7:30 p.m. 
Friday, March 21, 9:30-10:30 a.m. and 6:30-7:30 p.m. 
Saturday, March 22, 10:30-11:30 a.m., 2:30-3:30 p.m., and 6:30-7:30 p.m. 
Sunday, March 23, 10:30-11:30 a.m., 2:30-3:30 p.m., and 6:30-7:30 p.m.

Verizon Center

Materials will be provided.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 straight hours—and often 60 to 70 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (an elephant-training tool that resembles a fireplace poker), in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about how animals suffer behind the scenes at Ringling, check out RinglingBeatsAnimals.com
799362516760134.name: Washington DC: Ringling Protest

After their debut in DC 2 years ago at the Millennium Stage at the Kennedy Center, Alsarah & the Nubatones couldn't imagine having their debut album release without having a special celebration in Washington DC, aka 'little east-africa'. 

So on March 28th at 8pm, you are all cordially invited to Tropicalia at 8pm for a very special Silt album release party with special guest DJ Underdog

The group's debut album titled Silt / طمي will be released world wide on March 11, 2014 on Wonderwheel Recordings. The Nubatones original composition Soukura (it’s late) is the first release off the album.

Pre-Order The Album - https://wonderwheelrecordings.bandcamp.com/album/soukura-ep

Inspired by the pentatonic scale and western soul music, and struck by a collective love for Nubian music, Alsarah and the Nubatones revisit Nubian songs of return, as well as popular songs from northern Sudan and southern Egypt, from the 1970s until today. While linguistically there has been a rapid arabization of that region, its retention of its musical culture has been steadfast.

Photo: Jennifer Samuel
Flyer design: Maryam Parwana

828377600522629.description:
Time for another awesome Home Studio Workshop!!!

We have had some amazing past few workshops with our friends at Pixel Poets but  we are ready to have a few more of our own.

Odette Delacroix is coming in all the way from LA and boy is she a one of a kind model. Odette has been shooting for over 5 years now and she has shot a wide variety of genres. From Glamour, Fetish, Artistic to many more, she has shot it all.



So lets get to the fun.

Downstairs… a living room with a pair of couches and chairs with a hanging back drop as needed/desired.


Upstairs… a bedroom setting perfect for shooting those “sexy, under the sheets” shots with the soft natural light of day.

Okay… so now for the details…

We will be shooting Odette in three different sets with each photographer having roughly 8-12 minutes to shoot with her in each set.

First set… "Glamour Sexy High Key Lighting Setup" on our black or white backdrop.

Second set… "On the Couch-Little more artistic lighting/shadowy Setup with a Implied/Lingerie Look". 


Third set… "On the Bed". Odette will be doing sexy nude & implied poses on the Bed/Near the Window area and of course all these will be without any need of direction… unless of course you like directing.



This will be a 3 hour workshop and that is plenty of time to get some amazing shots. Odette has an amazing and interesting portfolio on Model Mayhem ( http://www.modelmayhem.com/1926224 ) and if you would like to shoot with her afterward definitely don't miss this opportunity. This is her first time to DC.


The Price will be $100.. ($60 to RSVP your spot at then event and $40 due at the event)

There will limit it to 4 photographers so don't miss your spot.

There will be a few 30 minute blocks of time available after the shoot to work with Odette privately at $50 each.

2:15 -2:45

3:00-3:30

3:45-4:15

829051673903018.description:
You are invited to attend a special presentation by Pastor Steve Khoury from Bethlehem this Wednesday, March 26 at 7 p.m. (Living Word's Wednesday night service.)

Pastor Khoury is a frequent speaker at CUFI's Washington, D.C. Annual Summit. He and his father are among the very few Palestinian Christians who support Israel. His father, Dr. Naim Khoury, had established a ministry in 1980. Today they are spreading the gospel throughout the Palestinian Territories and in Jerusalem, he pastors Calvary Baptist Church.

Ilan Sharon, our Israeli Jewish friend will join us as well to share about the special relationship he has with Pastor Khoury.

IMPORTANT NOTE for attendees who are not Living Word members: The presentation is part of Living Word's weekly Wednesday night service and will include Christian Praise and Worship in the first 15 minutes and the message from Pastor Khoury is a strong message of Christian faith, however, we believe it is great source of education to anyone that is interested in Israel and the story of the Christian minority living in Palestinian controlled area.

The Church has (as part of their regular Wednesday night service) Christian childcare for newborns thru 5th grade. The sanctuary also has balcony area which is great for families.
 
What: A Taste of CUFI's Washington, D.C. Summit 
 Story of Faith at Work in the Little Town of Bethlehem 
with Pastor Steve Khoury from Bethlehem (bio enclosed below)

When: 7 p.m., Wednesday, March 26, 2014
 
Where: Main Sanctuary
Living Word Christian Center
9201 75th Avenue N.
Brooklyn Park, MN
(12 minutes North from 394 & 169)

For map or directions either call (763) 315-7000 or click: http://bitly.com/1b8Pnym

RSVP is NOT required.

BRIEF BIO, Pastor Steve Khoury:
 
Growing up with daily persecution, Steven Khoury has seen church members attacked, subjected to discrimination, and lose their income all because of their faith. Several believers under his ministry have been martyred, including his own uncle, and several youth girls who invited children to vacation bible school. Persecution has always faced Pastor Khoury's life growing up as an Arab pastor during the intifadas.
 
Pastor Steven Khoury is the Vice President of Holy Land Missions, which has been reaching out to the lost in Israel for the past 30 years. Today, six locations around the country are actively serving the community and preaching the Gospel, including Calvary Church in Jerusalem and First Baptist in Bethlehem.
 
Pastor Khoury attended Bible College in Springfield, Missouri, where he received his Bachelor of Science in Pastoral Ministry and Theology. He is an affiliate with the Baptist Bible Fellowship International, the National Christian Foundation, and the Voice of the Martyrs Organization. He is the youngest ordained Israeli Arab pastor in Israel and the surrounding Arab countries.
 
Pastor Khoury is author of the book, Diplomatic Christianity: Standing in the Shadow of Tomorrow's Persecution. His ministry has been a topic in several books. Steven has also done numerous interviews, including recent broadcasts on FOX News and CBN.
829051673903018.location: Living Word Christian Center (Brooklyn Park, MN)
829051673903018.name: TODAY! A Guest Speaker from Israel in Minnesota - A Taste of CUFI's Washington, D.C. Summit
